I don‚Äôt like games that are lie downs and you dominate after a few rounds But this is far to the opposite extreme. It‚Äôs addictive but has some serious flaws. The game decides who‚Äôs going to win before it begins. There will be games where it will only allow your opponent to make tackles, rendering your defense just about useless. I don‚Äôt know why they bother having player levels. You‚Äôll have a team full of level 8 players but somehow all of your opponent‚Äôs level 4 and 5 players are smarter, stronger, and faster than your players. It‚Äôs absolutely illogical. You go to cancel a tackle in the box ahead of time, your player does it anyway and then the opponent gets a penalty kick. It‚Äôs maddening.

content.label: The AI is awful. Never seen a game with this blatantly bad AI and chooses when it wants you to mess up. Players get called for offsides when they are not or they are even with the defender. Clean slide tackles being called as bad tackles. Bad tackles not having an advantage or free kick. AI running straight into the defense for a tackle. The goalkeepers never block shots upfront. They just starfish and fall down. They don‚Äôt approach the ball like a keeper should. AI giving up the ball to defenders even when they have better height. There is a lot that needs to be fixed to make this a good game. I know it has been around for a little while but come on. Don‚Äôt release a game with these kind of mess ups.

Massively pay-to-win. Event tourneys are cool in concept until you‚Äôre matched with someone who has put in either plenty of hours or plenty of money (probably the latter) and can have one player run through your entire squad because he‚Äôs 10 levels higher than you.  Drawing comparisons between yours and your opponent‚Äôs AI‚Äîeven outside of tourneys‚Äîmakes your players look like they react and think like a Sunday league compared to the brutally superior and simply unfair opponent AI despite no apparent level differences.  I‚Äôm not sure how you find better keepers, but I‚Äôve noticed other players have different ones. If you get Taylor, I‚Äôd just delete the game as you‚Äôll concede more than you‚Äôll ever wish.  If you wanted a keeper worse than Kepa and David De Gea combined... well... that‚Äôs Taylor. However, the penalty system is well done though and I‚Äôve found myself thoroughly enjoying when a game goes to pens even when I lose simply because of the intensity, and I‚Äôm pretty sure this is because there aren‚Äôt any stat advantages, so Mr. Maxed-Out-His-Credit has to play without his monetary advantage. 

I have many footy games on my phone, this by far has to be my least favorite one. Not a bad game per say, but there exists a myriad of better options from this one. Some AI fixes to raise player IQs higher than those of tadpoles and for them to actually follow their dotted paths and a true matchmaking feature could greatly improve this game. Until then, 3/5 for me. 

TLDR: AI is poor; matchmaking is nonexistent; penalty shootouts are quite redeemable.

I‚Äôve been playing this game for over a year. It was very enjoyable. However, I made the mistake to actually put money into the game. The game isn‚Äôt worth putting any money into. The games are completely randomized. You never know what the CPU is going to do. As you rank up, you face different opponents but most of them have stronger players than you. So you‚Äôre stuck in this endless void of losing and not ranking up until you win just enough to be on the right level. The game is very buggy at times and the bs I‚Äôve experienced have literally made me audibly laugh. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this game just because of the sole glitches, bugs, and overall feel. I wish I could rate it higher but it‚Äôs just so many negatives compared to the positives.
All around the game is good but still has the AI problems from Score Hero, besides that it‚Äôs good
